ratings.comment: Worst professor ever. I can not believe why such a professor would be hired in this university? She made interesting and easy staff much more boring and confusing. No other words to say, do not take her course!

Dr. Dassow was such an sweet professor. She knows a lot about the subject and was really helpful in office hours. Her tests are pretty tough, but there's extra credit available, and she goes through all the questions and usually gives back a few points for the overly difficult questions. The class was pretty challenging, but it was 600 level.

She is awful. Her slides are super cluttered and she goes through them so fast that you can't keep up. She doesn't know how to explain things so they makes sense. Bio  was my favorite class and she made me not want to go to lecture. Just bad overall. The other two professors were great and her section was kinda short, but it was painful.
She was an awful professor. The lecture goes extremely fast without any helpful information on the confusing slides she makes. Print off the lecture slides it is easier to take notes.

Dr. Dassow is very passionate about what she teaches, the only problem is she can't. She knows her material, but has a hard time conveying it to students. The Bio 101 class is split into three professors, and she is the second. She constantly says "this test is usually the worst performed" because she is worst teacher of the three.

Her lectures are confusing and very detailed. Doesn't do a good job explaining the material. I learned more from the book than from lectures. It's better to print off the slides than using a notebook to write notes because her lectures are very fast paced and it's easy to not write everything down. Details matter on the test!

we have 3 lecturer for the Bio 101 course and unfortunately, Dr. Dassow is the worst. The test is very tricky, there are always option saying "a and b are correct" and "all of above are correct " in a single question. Further, she focus on many details, and those details need plenty of works memorize but she does not mention anything in the lecture
Never trust her about saying the questions in the exam are not tricky. The Q&A session before exam is useless and she did not provide any optional quzzies for students to practice.

There are three lecturers for this class, and she is BY FAR the worst, possibly the worst lecturer I have ever had here. She speaks in the same awful tone of voice for every sentence, moves through her unhelpful slides really fast, and is downright terrible at explaining concepts. I went to every one of her lectures and learned almost nothing.

Not the best lecturer. Tests are very tricky, with minute details inserted to try to make you choose the wrong answer. Other professors present the information straight up in their exams in this class, but not her.
Needs work on the lectures, but is very very willing to help during office hours and review sessions. If you make good use out of her you will do fine. Exams equally as hard as others for the class.

Worst of the three professors for this class. She didn't know how to "dumb" a lot of the material down for the 101 students so we could understand it. There was no practice exam for her section so studying was practically impossible. Maybe her second semester will be better because her first was a real struggle.

It was obvious that it was her first time being a professor in a large lecture hall. She just read everything word for word off of the powerpoint. It also didn't seem like she knew what she was talking about/seemed very inexperienced. Other than that, she was a very nice lady.
